attributes.action: Ask Mayor Sadiq Khan and The Home Office to reopen Richmond's Police Station
attributes.additional_details: In the borough of Richmond since the station closure until April 21 - 7 Gun crimes/personal robberies, 7 Homicides, 144 Knife crimes with injuries and 1464 Drug offences - Only 3 officers in North Richmond ward and 4 in South Richmond ward. There is huge demand amongst the local community for our local police station to be reinstated. Please can Sadiq Khan and/or the Home Office find funds. Plus extra police on patrol around the crime areas. Our neighbourhood needs to be safe and secure.
attributes.background: On November 1st 2017 Khan announced the closure of the station. Richmond Council said the closure “must have a local benefit”. "Police accessibility here in the borough should be improved on the ground". Cressida Dick, said "police most effective on the streets!"  ONLY 3 police officers in my ward!

rejection.details:
This is a matter for the Mayor of London and the Met Police.  You can find out about petitions to the London Assembly here:

https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions
